column4: Question about purging: I can't seem to purge (config files of) packages I've already removed.  Now, I want to purge "mysql", but "amarok" depends on "mysql" and I just want to remove and not purge "amarok".  Can I do this?  How?  (Prefer cmd-line.)
Can I do "sudo apt-get remove amarok --purge mysql" or something to selectively purge?
Oh, of course!  Remove amarok *first* and then it won't get affected by subsequent purge command!  Duhhh... thanks.
